test_patch:
diff --git a/test/sql/function/list/list_inner_product.test b/test/sql/function/list/list_inner_product.test
index 0430f04b9854..e1f76969b7d0 100644
--- a/test/sql/function/list/list_inner_product.test
+++ b/test/sql/function/list/list_inner_product.test
@@ -1,6 +1,11 @@
 # name: test/sql/function/list/list_inner_product.test
 # group: [list]
 
+query I
+SELECT list_inner_product([], []);
+----
+0.0
+
 foreach type FLOAT DOUBLE
 
 query I
problem_statement:
`LIST_DOT_PRODUCT([], [])`: INTERNAL Error: Operation requires a flat vector but a non-flat vector was encountered
### What happens?

running `SELECT LIST_DOT_PRODUCT([], [])` raises `INTERNAL Error: Operation requires a flat vector but a non-flat vector was encountered`

Error exists in some environments:
- mac m1, python, duckdb versions >=0.10.1

Does not exist:
- mac m1, python, duckdb==0.10.0
- shell.duckdb.org with duckdb 1.0.0

Maybe related to https://github.com/duckdb/duckdb/issues/11542? At least the same error message.

### To Reproduce

```python
import duckdb

sql = "SELECT LIST_DOT_PRODUCT([], [])"
duckdb.sql(sql)
```

### OS:

MacM1, MacOS 14.5

### DuckDB Version:

anything >=0.10.1

### DuckDB Client:

python

### Full Name:

Nick Crews

### Affiliation:

Ship Creek Group

### What is the latest build you tested with? If possible, we recommend testing with the latest nightly build.

I have tested with a stable release

### Did you include all relevant data sets for reproducing the issue?

Yes

### Did you include all code required to reproduce the issue?

- [X] Yes, I have

### Did you include all relevant configuration (e.g., CPU architecture, Python version, Linux distribution) to reproduce the issue?

- [X] Yes, I have
